children.subject:
Not sure about the course captures for this semester, but you can find the webcasts from spring 2019 (and a bunch of semesters before that) at webcast.berkeley.edu.

On a related note, if you're looking for course content, you can find homeworks / discussions / etc from previous semesters at [semester].eecs70.org, where [semester] is fa, sp, or su and the year (ie, fall 2018 would be at fa18.eecs70.org, spring 2019 would be at sp19.eecs70.org, etc).  These won't have solutions posted (since we reuse problems from semester to semester), but you can still use them for practice!

history.content:
Just use a previous semester's webcasts from here: https://coursecapture.berkeley.edu/compsci-70

We didn't cover some of the material in sp20 anyways, so it wouldn't be the best bet if you're trying to study everything

children.subject: The notes are arguably the most important resource in the class. I would use them as a primary study resource, then use discussions for practice.

history.content: Hello. I want to study CS 70 before I take it this fall. Where can I find the Zoom recordings for this class in addition to the course captures before the pandemic hit?
history.subject: CS 70 lectures for spring 2020
